Title: From Problem Solvers to Innovators: The New Role of Solutions Architects in the Age of AI
Abstract: Discover how AI has transformed Solutions Architects from problem solvers to innovators and strategic thinkers. This session will highlight the new dimensions added to the role by AI technologies.

Title: Engineering the Future of Pharma: AI-Driven Platforms for Drug Discovery
Abstract: Dive into how AI-driven platform engineering is transforming pharma! Discover how leveraging AI slashes drug development costs by 70% and speeds up market entry, revolutionizing treatment delivery and response to health crises. Join us for a glimpse into the future of healthcare.

JobTitle1: Vice President, Global CTO Applications & Cloud technologies
Title: Platform Engineering Rescues Your GenAI Use Cases at Scale
Abstract: Discover composable enterprise GenAI app platform engineering practices to enable scalable GenAI infusion into your applications.

Title: Optimizing Offer Management Through Enterprise Application Integration (EAI): A Data-Driven Approach
Abstract: Unlock the power of Enterprise Application Integration (EAI) to boost customer engagement and retention! Discover how strategic EAI implementation enhances personalized offer management, increases conversion rates, and reduces costs.

Title: Intelligent Conversational System for Personalized EB-1A Guidance and Self-Discovery Using AI
Abstract: Revolutionize immigration with AI! Discover the EB1A Xpert BOT's cutting-edge tech and personalized guidance for extraordinary individuals. Learn about its innovative design, security, and future plans reshaping EB-1A applications. Explore the future of AI-driven immigration assistance!

Title: Revolutionizing Sustainability: AI-Driven Disassembly for a Circular Economy
Abstract: Unlock the future of sustainable manufacturing with our talk on AI-driven product disassembly! Learn how integrating AI, advanced sensors, and robotics transforms recycling, boosts material recovery by 50%, cuts waste, and fosters a circular economy. Join us to lead the charge in eco-innovation!

Title: Revolutionizing Customer Service with AI-Enhanced Chatbots
Abstract: Discover how AI-enhanced chatbots are revolutionizing customer service! Learn how these advanced bots provide 24/7 personalized support, drastically reduce response times, and continuously improve through machine learning.

Title: Stress-Free Deployment with Kubernetes API Gateway and Platform Engineering for Large Companies
Abstract: I will share a use case of an early adopter, Sonatel, utilizing Kubernetes API Gateway and platform engineering. I will share how this combination benefits companies by enabling operations teams to confidently ship new features without breaking things while devs remain 100% focused on writing code.

Title: Kubernetes Deployment from Platform to API
Abstract: Organizations that adopt Kubernetes aim to improve productivity and the developer experience when deploying applications. We will explore various perspectives on application deployment in Kubernetes and highlight the open-source tooling and AWS solutions that enable these advancements.

Title: Data as API: A Principled Data Storage Approach for Machine Learning Projects. Case Study from Snapchat 3D Tracking Team
Abstract: I present a case study from the Snapchat 3D tracking team, where the transition to a unified data storage API allowed them to improve the performance of training pipelines and shorten iteration times.

Title: Mastering Code Review: Elevating Quality and Efficiency in Software Engineering
Abstract: Learn how self-code reviews elevate software quality and efficiency. Liora Friedberg from Jane Street Capital shares practical techniques and tools to master this essential practice, ensuring your code is robust and error-free.

Title: Building a Serverless GenAI Platform
Abstract: Natural language is the new programming language. It allows even non-technical people to create powerful generative AI applications. Learn how to build a safe, secure self-service GenAI platform that automates infrastructure, access control, guardrails, and observability for your teams.

Title: AI-Augmented DevOps with Platform Engineering
Abstract: Explore the fusion of AI with DevOps and platform engineering to automate workflows, enhance efficiency, and drive innovation. Learn about cutting-edge tools, practices, and future trends.

Title: DOWN with Shift Left: Why You Should Be Shifting DOWN into the Platform
Abstract: Shift Left has often added stress rather than solving problems. This talk introduces Shifting Down by empowering platforms to handle complexities developers shouldn’t face. Learn how intelligent platforms can automate tasks like scanning, manifest generation, and image building to improve efficiency.

Title: Beauty and the Build: Charlotte Tilbury’s Move from CloudFormation to Terraform
Abstract: Discover why Charlotte Tilbury Beauty is moving from AWS CloudFormation to Terraform, how they’re doing it, the use of the new import command block, and the challenges and lessons they’ve learned along the way.

Title: Building Efficient and Frugal Image Data Processing Pipelines
Abstract: Having trouble processing large datasets of images? Want to achieve lightning-fast image processing without breaking the bank? Let me walk you through creating data pipelines that are lean, mean, and optimized for speed and cost.

Title: Beyond the Code: Building Cyber-Awareness in Platform Development Teams
Abstract: Take your platform development team's security mindset to the next level with "Beyond the Code: Building Cyber-Awareness in Platform Development Teams." Learn how to cultivate a culture of cyber-awareness, integrate best practices, and protect your platforms from modern threats. Empower your team!

Title: Building Platform Interfaces with ArgoCD
Abstract: In this session, we will dive deep into the central role of ArgoCD in building Internal Developer Platforms (IDPs). Explore how ArgoCD streamlines deployments and serves as the core API for developer interactions within IDPs.

Title: How to Build Jenkins as the CI/CD Platform in a Company
Abstract: It is 2024, and Jenkins is more alive than ever. Learn how to standardize pipelines and make execution generic for all your workloads. In this talk, we'll explore how we successfully onboarded users and drove adoption of new features, which is crucial for a platform team.

Title: Building a Network Telemetry Platform to Minimize Security Threats
Abstract: In today's digital landscape, network security is paramount. Imagine a platform that gathers telemetry from virtual machines, scrutinizes traffic for anomalies, and alerts teams to take swift action. This approach minimizes the attack surface, ensuring security across the entire infrastructure.

Title: Building Resilient Microservices: Platform Engineering Best Practices
Abstract: Using a hypothetical e-commerce platform as a case study, we will delve into key aspects such as service discovery, load balancing, and orchestration, illustrating how these can be effectively managed within a microservices ecosystem.

Title: Harnessing Microfrontends: Building Scalable, Reliable, and Secure Platforms for Complex Web Applications
Abstract: Unlock the power of microfrontends. This session reveals how breaking down web apps into smaller, deployable units boosts scalability and reliability. Learn how this approach streamlines development, supports incremental migration, and enhances operational efficiency for complex applications.

JobTitle1: Regional Head of Enterprise Modernization, Platforms and Cloud Service Line
Title: Platform Engineering ROI: Mapping Engineering Outcomes to Business Value
Abstract: Conveying the value of platform engineering to business leaders can be challenging due to its technical nature. This session outlines a strategy for aligning platform engineering initiatives with business objectives in a way that secures endorsement from business sponsors.

Title: Taming the Big Data Beast: Platform Engineering for Efficient Data Pipelines
Abstract: Concepts of functional programming and performance optimization are my specialty when addressing challenges associated with big data. Let's connect to explore how I can help your organization build efficient data pipelines that drive business value.

Title: The Engineer’s Guide to Business Mastery: Thinking Beyond the Blueprint
Abstract: Discover how to elevate your engineering career by mastering business skills. I’ll show you how to communicate effectively with stakeholders and strategically advance using real-world examples.

Title: Conquering Hybrid DNS with Route 53 Resolver
Abstract: Nobody cares about DNS until it stops working. As platform engineers, we should accept this prevailing apathy. At the same time, building a robust Cloud (AWS) platform that addresses DNS management over a hybrid network remains a crucial tenet in sustaining this omnipresent apathy.

Title: Efficient Pseudo-Volumetric Rendering in Mobile Games for Fog Clouds and Smoke
Abstract: A plethora of tricks is required to craft a high-performance illusion of real cloud, fog, or smoke in a mobile game. In this talk, you will learn how to simulate volumetrics like a pro!

Title: Want to Run Containers on AWS? Here’s How!
Abstract: Discover the game-changing differences in AWS container services! Learn how to navigate ECS, EKS, Fargate, and App Runner efficiently. Join me to unlock the secrets of service selection!

Title: The Future of Work: Engaged Leaders and Empowered Teams
Abstract: Discover how to become an engaged leader and create a trusted workplace. Using real stories from the software industry, this talk equips professionals with practical skills to foster trust, enhance communication, and empower teams, driving retention and productivity in the virtual environment.

Title: Principles of Team Topologies Applied to Platform Engineering
Abstract: Building platforms for automotive embedded systems may feel different from those for high-frequency trading algorithms or highly secure government services. However, certain patterns and principles consistently distinguish those who will excel from those who will be mediocre at best.

Title: Navigating the Developer's Journey: Crafting an Effective Roadmap for Success
Abstract: Don’t miss this conference session for practical insights into crafting your developer roadmap. We’ll start by discussing pain points and exploring challenges developers encounter. Learn valuable strategies to work backward and propel your technical product forward.

Title: The Streaming Plane
Abstract: The streaming plane connects the operational and analytical aspects of data processing. It captures and processes real-time data, allowing it to flow seamlessly. This bridge enables organizations to make faster, data-driven decisions based on both real-time and historical data.

Title: Many Layers of Availability
Abstract: Discover the true path to building reliable systems beyond microservices. Join my talk to explore the interconnected factors of availability, from infrastructure to architecture. You’ll leave with a comprehensive roadmap for achieving high availability in advanced cloud-native systems.

Title: High-Load Systems: Overcoming Challenges in Social Network Development
Abstract: Learn from Aleksander Kolobov, ex-team lead at VK, one of the world's largest social networks, on how to scale architecture. Discover strategies for optimizing performance, mastering data management, and ensuring reliability—all while handling 10,000+ requests per second with sub-300ms latency.

Title: When Clusters Collide: The Misadventures of Disaster Recovery in Kubernetes
Abstract: Join us for an in-depth exploration of Kubernetes disaster recovery, going beyond the basic setup of twin EKS clusters and DNS switches. This talk covers practical strategies, common challenges, and solutions, making it ideal for those with intermediate knowledge of Kubernetes, DevOps, and the Cloud.

Title: DevOps, 12-Factor, and Platform Engineering
Abstract: Learn about the business wisdom of the 70s and 80s and how it laid the foundation for modern, cloud-native systems incorporating DevOps practices. Get a glimpse into what's next by exploring internal developer portals.

Title: Building Developer-Driven Platforms: Automation and UI Excellence
Abstract: Unlock the secrets to seamless developer experiences with insights from Facebook/Meta and Cloudera. This session will reveal strategies for intuitive UI design and effective automation, covering tools like deployment pipelines and orchestration frameworks.

Title: Rust's Async Ecosystem: Exploring the Libraries and Frameworks
Abstract: Master Rust's async ecosystem! Explore libraries and frameworks like Tokio, async-std, and Actix Web to build scalable and efficient platforms. Unleash Rust's concurrency power!

Title: Transforming Cybersecurity Governance with GenAI: New Paradigms in Risk and Compliance
Abstract: Explore how Generative AI revolutionizes cybersecurity in our session! Learn about its impact on GRC, enhancing policy enforcement, improving threat prediction by 30%, and cutting compliance issues by 25%. Elevate your cybersecurity to new heights with GenAI.

Title: AI-Augmented Platform Engineering
Abstract: AI-augmented platform engineering is transforming software delivery in 2024. By integrating predictive and generative AI, platforms are improving developer experience, efficiency, and infrastructure optimization.

Title: Developer Real-Time Alerts and Guidance Using Generative AI
Abstract: The post-facto nature of traditional data mining techniques often renders their insights too late for developers to act promptly. We propose a Generative AI-powered, multi-dimensional mining and insights framework that provides continuous, real-time actionable guidance to inform their decisions.

Title: Platform Engineering Untold Truths: Is It Just an Infrastructure Matter?
Abstract: To streamline delivery, companies need a structured approach through platform engineering. This approach goes beyond just infrastructure. Effective platforms must focus on data, composability, and the entire organizational framework. Let's explore the core principles for successful platform engineering.

Title: From Months to Minutes: Unified Path to Live Initiative for Self-Serviceable Enterprise Patterns
Abstract: This talk explores the Unified Path to Live, an initiative that slashed infrastructure provisioning from months to minutes. Learn how the Platform Engineering group broke down silos, built self-service infrastructure with Backstage and IaC, and empowered developers for faster deployments.

Title: Beyond Connectivity: Full Life-Cycle Infrastructure Orchestration and Cost Engineering
Abstract: Join us to learn about our exciting shift from black-box infrastructure to self-managed empowerment for developers. Our IDP streamlines decentralization with Infrastructure as Code and a user-friendly UI, ensuring secure, scalable support for over 10 million connected appliances worldwide.

Title: When Infrastructure as Code Ends: The Practical Guide to Creating Terraform Providers
Abstract: Adding new functionality to Terraform can be daunting: it’s written in Go (which you might not know) and requires understanding the architecture and navigating less-than-welcoming documentation. I’ll provide a walkthrough from my experience, guiding you from zero to publishing a provider.

Title: AIOps + HumanOps: Forging a Balanced Partnership for Kubernetes Management
Abstract: AIOps can automate repetitive tasks, predict potential issues, and provide actionable insights, while HumanOps brings invaluable decision-making and a culture of continuous improvement. This balance ensures that neither AIOps nor HumanOps overshadows the other; instead, they work together to manage Kubernetes effectively.

Title: Breaking Down the Principles of Platform Engineering: How to Empower Developer Experience
Abstract: Building an app? It sounds simple, right—just open my IDE and start coding. But what about the container runtime, registry, YAML for deploying to Kubernetes, CI/CD, and more? Platform engineering is how we enable organizations to manage this complexity, abstract it, and let developers continue to code.

Title: From Free-Kicks to Git Commits
Abstract: Join me as I transition from football to tech, focusing on Kubernetes. Learn how teamwork, discipline, and strategy from sports have influenced my tech career. Discover my journey into building developer platforms and explore the parallels between leading a sports team and orchestrating cloud-native environments.

Title: Building Observability into Your iOS App Platform: Tools, Techniques, and Best Practices
Abstract: Dive into the essential world of Observability and discover the pivotal differences from Monitoring. From development analytics to the art of log management, learn how to collect, store, and analyze data like a pro.

JobTitle1: Associate Director / Senior Systems Engineering Manager
Title: AWS Observability as Code: Leveraging Datadog for Advanced Platform Engineering
Abstract: Observability is a core challenge in modern platform engineering, complicated by diverse tools and dynamic environments. Leveraging AWS and Datadog as code can resolve these issues, creating a streamlined observability platform that enhances monitoring, reliability, and system management.

Title: Making Sense of Mixed Application Deployments
Abstract: Mixed environment deployments using serverless and containerized components are gaining popularity. This session explores strategies and architectural considerations for implementing these deployments. We'll also discuss the importance of observability in simplifying and troubleshooting them.

Title: Importance of Observability in Platform Engineering
Abstract: By correlating metrics, logs, and traces, platform teams can optimize resource allocation, accelerate troubleshooting, enhance developer experience, improve reliability, and make data-driven decisions for platform evolution.

Title: The Road Ahead: Istio Observability
Abstract: Istio: A Game-Changer for Microservices. In today's fast-paced tech world, effective microservices management is essential. This talk dives deep into Istio Observability (O11y), showcasing how it accelerates development, enhances quality, and drives market competitiveness.

Title: Enhancing Software Engineering Skills Through Algorithms and Data Structures Mastery
Abstract: Elevate your software engineering skills by mastering algorithms and data structures—the backbone of optimized and scalable code.

Title: Optimizing High-Volume Financial Transactions: A Java Microservices Approach
Abstract: Unlock the power of Java and microservices to transform financial transaction processing with scalable solutions and real-world applications.

Title: Unveiling Oracle RICE: A Comprehensive Guide to Optimizing Reports, Interfaces, Conversions, and Extensions
Abstract: Unlock the full potential of Microsoft Fabric with RICE! Learn to boost efficiency by 30%, reduce data transfer errors by 40%, and cut migration time by 50%. Discover how tailored reports, seamless interfaces, and streamlined conversions can drive your success.

Title: Billions of Records in MySQL: Lessons Learned
Abstract: Database performance issues are always a concern. If you're asking, "How do I optimize MySQL for big data?" or struggling to achieve and maintain high performance on your MySQL instances, this talk is for you. We will also cover bugs in MySQL discovered by the Lukas.

Title: The Future of Platform Engineering
Abstract: This talk explores the future of platform engineering, focusing on abstractions, standards, characteristics, and mechanisms. It discusses a decentralized platform approach and various platform levels.

Title: Demystifying Developer Experience Through Platform Engineering
Abstract: Enhancing developer experience is essential for driving productivity and fostering innovation. We will demystify platform engineering by examining its impact on developer experience, leveraging the latest trends and technologies. The session will cover developer portals, self-service infrastructure, and best practices.

Title: Cross-Platform Development from the Perspective of the Native Mobile Developer
Abstract: Join Dmitry, a seasoned iOS developer, as he shares his thrilling journey into cross-platform development with Yandex. Discover the challenges, advantages, and real-world insights of using Flutter, and explore other cross-platform options.

Title: Platforms MUST Be Small, Regardless of Their Size
Abstract: New platforms are inherently disruptive technologies because they are often designed to abstract away or replace existing ones. There are common traits that help disruptive products succeed. I will discuss how "perceived size" is the most important trait of the platforms we're building today.

Title: Cognitive Load Recognition: Techniques and Tips for Platform Analysis
Abstract: I bet 80% of our event talks will be technical or architectural. But what about analysis? The platform is just another system, so it's crucial to analyze the needs and problems of your users—developers and operations teams. I’ll share a few useful techniques and tips. Technology is useless without this understanding!

Title: How to Secure Your Containers at Scale
Abstract: Join us to explore the future of application security in containerized environments! Discover a high-level design of a hands-free automation system that seamlessly remediates vulnerabilities in container images. Elevate your enterprise’s security posture by automatically protecting your applications.

JobTitle1: Generative AI, AI/ML Architect, MLOps, and Security
Title: LLM SecOps
Abstract: LLMs like ChatGPT and Bard revolutionize language processing but face security risks. My talk covers SecOps best practices, automation for data hygiene, and DevSecOps collaboration to secure LLMs and ensure a trustworthy AI ecosystem.

Title: Enhancing Cloud Computing Security with Multi-Layered Protection and Advanced Threat Detection
Abstract: As cloud computing spending soars to $1.3 trillion by 2025, securing cloud environments is crucial. Discover cutting-edge cloud security strategies, multilayered protection, and advanced threat detection. Learn from real-world case studies and proactive measures to safeguard data and reduce breach times.

Title: Implementing Email Attachment Security
Abstract: In our everyday experience, we frequently receive emails with attachments containing personal information. If these emails are mistakenly forwarded to the wrong person, it could compromise our data. To prevent such risks, I am keen to discuss implementing security measures for email attachments.

Title: Bridging the Gap: Real-Time Topology as the Connective Tissue Between Platform Engineering and SRE
Abstract: Discover how real-time topology graphs can enhance platform engineering by creating a shared framework between SRE and engineering teams, improving reliability and providing crucial runtime context for internal developer platforms – plus what cybersecurity teaches us about closing the loop.

Title: How to Build Cloud-Native Platforms with Kubernetes
Abstract: Platform Engineering and SRE focus on empowering developers and organizations by creating and maintaining internal software products known as platforms. In this blog, we will explore what platforms are, why they are important, and uncover best practices for well-architected platforms.

Title: Building Secure and Flexible Multi-Cloud Images with Multi-Boot Mode: A Comprehensive CI/CD Approach
Abstract: Step into the world of innovation as I unveil our SRE team's strategy for Cisco's 'Resource Connector.' Witness how we integrate GitHub Actions, Packer, Ansible, Python, Golang, and Bash, revolutionizing multi-cloud delivery. Real-world examples will highlight our commitment to efficiency and reliability.

Title: Crafting Resilient Integration Solutions with Mulesoft
Abstract: Discover how to integrate diverse systems, data sources, APIs, and legacy apps using integration patterns. Join us for a technical deep dive into data aggregation, real-time synchronization, event broadcasting, and more. Learn how to architect resilient solutions and see how MuleSoft simplifies this process.

Title: Building vs. Buying: A Tale of Developing an In-House SCA Tool
Abstract: Detail the journey of developing an in-house SCA tool, from its inception as a challenge to its realization as a comprehensive, open-source solution. This presentation will cover the motivations, challenges, and unique features of the tool, including dependency checks, custom dashboards, and automatic updates.

Title: Unleashing the Power of EKS: What's New and Best Practices
Abstract: Unlock the full potential of EKS with the latest features and best practices. From cluster health monitoring to simplified access management, IAM integration to network policy support, and add-ons for observability, this talk will equip you with the tools to supercharge your Kubernetes experience on AWS.

Title: The Code Behind Every Real-Time Collaboration Tool
Abstract: Presentation on the PubSub design pattern and WebSocket will showcase real-case scenarios.

Title: Renovate to Innovate: Fundamentals of Transforming Legacy Architecture
Abstract: In this talk, I outline my learnings on gracefully outgrowing technology and architectural choices, drawing from my experience scaling payment orchestration at Netflix to 250 million members and preparing for the next 250 million.

Title: Chaos as an Art: Crafting Chaos, Creating Order
Abstract: Imagine a canvas where chaos reigns supreme, but within its depths, a jaw-dropping order emerges. Witness chaos transformed into art and order into a masterpiece. In this talk, we will explore how to organize chaos in a controlled manner and create chaos scenarios with k6 fault injection.

Title: Hack the Future: Mastering Pre-Mortem Analysis for Success
Abstract: Discover powerful strategies for anticipating and avoiding project pitfalls with the proven Pre-Mortem Analysis method. Unleash your team's potential to innovate, excel, and elevate your tech projects to unprecedented success!

Title: Effortless Concurrency: Leveraging the Actor Model in Financial Transaction Systems
Abstract: Discover how our startup leverages the Actor model with Golang and Kafka to revolutionize financial transaction processing. Dive into real-world applications and learn how to simplify and scale systems effortlessly, proving that the best concurrency is no concurrency.
